title: Effects of Jaya CB buying bonds from NassimBank

content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

Nassim Bank is a commercial bank in Jaya with the following balance sheet (T-account). The banking system in Jaya has limited reserves.

Assets

Liabilities

Reserves

<math alttext="$80,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mtext>$80,000</mtext></mstyle></math>
 Demand Deposits

<math alttext="$400,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mtext>$400,000</mtext></mstyle></math>

Government Bonds

<math alttext="$920,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mtext>$920,000</mtext></mstyle></math>
 Owners’ Equity

<math alttext="$600,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mtext>$600,000</mtext></mstyle></math>

(a) Calculate the required reserve ratio if Nassim Bank holds no excess reserves. Show your work.

(b) The central bank of Jaya buys <math alttext="$20,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mtext>$20,000</mtext></mstyle></math> of government bonds from Nassim Bank. What is the dollar value of the change in the monetary base? Explain using numbers.

(c) Based on your answer to part (a), calculate the maximum change in the money supply as a result of the central bank bond purchase after all adjustments take place in the banking system. Show your work.

(d) Given the change in the money supply in part (c), calculate the velocity of money if nominal gross domestic product changes by <math alttext="$500,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mtext>$500,000</mtext></mstyle></math>. Show your work.

(e) Assume the economy of Jaya is initially at full employment. Based solely on the change in the money supply in part (c), will the price level increase, decrease, or stay the same in the short run? Explain.
